level.heading: Definitions.
level.text: For the purposes of this chapter, the term:
Employee means an individual employed by an employer.

“Employer” means an individual, firm, association, or corporation who uses the services of another individual for pay in the District; provided, that the term employer does not include the District or the federal government.
Wages shall have the same meaning as provided in § 32-1301(3).

level.heading: Legislative history of Law 20-219
level.text: Law 20-219, the “Wage Transparency Act of 2014,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 20-757. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on Nov. 18, 2014, and Dec. 2, 2014, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on Dec. 19, 2014, it was assigned Act No. 20-531 and transmitted to Congress for its review. D.C. Law 20-219 became effective on Mar. 11, 2015.
